1.title: Business Analyst 2
1.text: The esMD Business Analyst will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, validating, and documenting esMD system, functional, EDI and reports requirements by translating Change Requests to Business requirements and functional specifications. Having a day to day interaction with the customer and product owners by directly interacting and analyzing the requirements during the RWS (Release working sessions and design calls).
description: Develop Gap Analysis documentation to define customers' business needs
Act as a liaison or subject matter experts (SMEs) by working closely with the client, design/development team and testing team.
Hands on experience in SDLC, Waterfall, RUP, and Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.
Works closely with Product Owners on the release timelines and schedules associated to Shared Systems, HIH and RCs schedule.
Must participate in various scrum ceremonies such as in backlog grooming, prioritizing/ranking, estimation, daily standup calls, sprint status calls provide velocity reports, etc.
Participate in Sprint Retrospectives, system demos and iteration planning to define Objectives, EPICS and User Stories with PMs, PO and RTEs.
Good participator in various scrum ceremonies such as grooming, prioritizing/ranking, estimation, validate and certify, daily standup calls, track status, provide velocity reports, etc.
Translates Change Requests or Business requirements to detailed user, functional, and systems requirements, using waterfall and agile methodology.

Responsible for creating/updating documents required as part of an agile system development lifecycle including user stories, detailed functional specifications, technical design input, process documents (such as SOP's, guidelines, and validation master plans), etc.
Facilitate different requirement gathering sessions, such as Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions, design, peer review and demo sessions to generate uses cases
Experience in any EDI transaction such as X12 278, 275, 834, 835 and 837 preferred.
Experience using management tools such as Confluence, SNOW, JIRA, Remedy, HP ALM etc.
Experience using any API Tools and ability to understand XML or JSON files.
Experience in creating mockups and wireframes to convert and display data in the form of reports and making them 508 compliant.
Knowledge with any DB Tools and minimum hands experience on querying the database.
Experience in manual, automation, integration, UAT and 508 compliance testing using any API tools.
Participate and educate end user during the UAT and Production phase.
Document detailed meeting minutes, design related questions, solutions, and decisions during the Requirements working and JAD sessions.
Be and expert in documenting FSD, ICD, RTM, Implementation and Companion Guides for every release and getting them peer reviewed and signoffs.
Must have a go to attitude and capable to switch roles, by wearing a Scrum Master or Tester hats on needs basis.
Excellent communication, managerial and interpersonal skills.

primary: Minimum three (5) years of proven experience in requirements capture, management and analysis activities along all phases of the software development life cycle.

Minimum three (3) years of proven experience in (I) developing “as is”, “to be” and context diagrams, (II) translating high level business requirements into detailed use cases and flow diagrams (III) developing detailed system and functional requirements, and functional specifications documents.
Proven experience working on backend or system software development projects, using the agile methodology.
Proven experience in Waterfall, RUP, Iterative and Agile methodologies.
Solid oral and written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical topics to management and non-technical audiences.
Strong and clear communication skills.
Excellent analytical skills, the ability to integrate information from multiple sources to execute effectively and efficiently in a dynamic environment.
Ability to work independently and interact regularly with government and non-government personnel at multiple levels of authority.
secondary: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or comparable experience
SCRUM master certification or the equivalent
Health Care Industry or CMS experience is PREFERRED
Experience in any EDI transaction is PREFERRED
Experience with Webservices tools such as SOAP UI, REST API etc.
Experience with any 508 Tools and concepts
Works well as a team member in a high-stress, often time sensitive environment.
text: Decalogue INC is an equal opportunity employer committed to upholding equal treatment to all staff.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, marital status, sexual orientation, age, parental status, national origin, disability status, family or genetics background, or any other non-merit based factors. 2.title: Dot Net Developer
2.text: Decalogue INC is seeking a mid-level C# and .NET developer to develop and deliver web-based enterprise software solutions that positively impact the health and safety of people throughout the world at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
description: Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code in ReactJS
Estimate the level of development tasks within a project
Create new and update existing project modules
Integrate with back-end Restful APIs
Develops web pages using latest responsive design development techniques
MUST have Hands-on experience in ReactJS and delivered project on ReactJS and played key role.
Should have strong debugging Skills and working with Cross Browser UI
Having experience in Python is a big plus
Good Communication Skills

skills.primary: React JS, JSON, JavaScript framework, Angular, Angular JS, web services.
skills.text: Decalogue INC is an equal opportunity employer committed to upholding equal treatment to all staff.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, marital status, sexual orientation, age, parental status, national origin, disability status, family or genetics background, or any other non-merit based factors. 3.title: Java Lead
text: Lead the architecture and design approach for the platform API and data services, develop and maintain architecture diagrams, data models, and other technical documentation. Additionally. you will work with management on roadmap planning and provide status on the overall plan, schedule, and risks for the team providing technical mentorship and apply best practices with other team members in the SW architecture department.
description: 8 + years’ experience with Java and/or other functional programming languages
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field
Serve as the lead software developer overseeing project design and development.
Ensure team adheres to Agile processes and software engineering best practices.
8+ years’ experience of software development in building distributed application systems or enterprise software systems
3+ years’ experience building backend software services and APIs
Work closely with the Product Manager, Business Analyst, and Chief Engineer to develop the best technical designs and solutions for the program.
Experience in a role where you led or influenced software architecture decisions
Liaise with external and internal customer stakeholders on technical design decisions and trade-offs and ensure software solution will meet required functional, performance, and SLA thresholds.
2+ experience developing cloud applications on AWS, Azure, or GCP using IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS offerings and developing scalable architectures
Solid understanding of fundamental web service technologies such as REST or SOAP
2+ years of experience with SOA based integration techniques using web services, XML/JSON/HTTPS, etc
Hands-on experience with Git - Specific experience with agile methodologies (Kanban, SCRUM, XP) and modern software development environments
Ability to work on remote agile teams, self-motivated, work independently
Ability to work in a DevOps team
Proven experience with the complete product life cycle in a production services environment, including design, implementation, load, and scale testing, deployment, and maintenance
Experience with HL7 FHIR and EHR/EMR
Evaluate the selection and/or hiring of team members to ensure team has the right balance of skills and experience to implement the solution.
Plan and estimate development tasks and work to improve performance metrics.

primary: Domain knowledge in HealthCare, claims, EHR is a big plus
Experience with more than one cloud environment - Azure, GCP, Rackspace
Experience with Health Care environment is a big plus
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Bamboo is a plus
Familiarity with different programming languages such as Java, SpringBoot and  JavaScript
Familiarity with Kubernetes is a plus

Broad range of technology interests across different disciplines including computer and system architecture, web applications, performance analysis, distributed systems design, testing, and verification technologies, data processing, and networking

4.title: System Architect 2
text: Decalogue INC is seeking a Lead Solutions Architect to develop solutions that positively impact the health and safety of people throughout the world at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
description: Lead the development of innovative solutions in support of FDA program delivery in the Adverse Events reporting space. Identifying system constraints, technical and stakeholder requirements and considerations, and balancing these solutions against cost, schedule, function, quality, and other business considerations.
Participate as a core member of the Agile team across all planning, analysis, design, development, and testing activities
Must be up to date on the current technology landscape, be technology agnostic, and have a passion for staying current and experimenting with new approaches and tools
Deliver on a system modernization project in which business capabilities previously provided by a legacy system are re-developed on a new platform or technology
Work with complex data and understand the current technologies available for data analysis, processing, and visualization
Provide leadership in the development of the systems integration capabilities across multiple accounts within the business.

Oversee technical delivery for alignment with FDA environment constraints, industry best practices, and emerging technical opportunities to provide a highly available, best value solution to the FDA customer.
Support program management and business development reviews and assist in improving performance of existing projects as required.

Create white papers, proposals, and briefings demonstrating the thought leadership capabilities of the organization, as well as supporting various marketing and business development efforts through customer interaction.
Collaborate with the Business Analysts, test team and leads and provide documentation for customer deliverables
Lead design, development, code inspections and test inspections throughout the life cycle to identify issues/defects and participate in other meetings such as use case creation technical interchanges
Develop estimates for design and implementation based on a level of effort and relative sizing (small, medium, large) depending on complexity of the requirements
Comply with CMMI level 3 or higher and project level processes to improve efficiency and consistency of all deliverables
Guide and mentor junior staff within the project
Coordinate closely with peers to ensure proper implementation of system specifications and integration of the new development with the complete system

primary: Minimum of Bachelors’ degree and 10 - 15 years of prior relevant experience;. Industry certifications will be considered in augmenting years of experience.
Related business environments such as Health Care or Life Sciences will be considered.

Experience (at least 5 years) in three of the following areas, with Expertise in at least one: System Architecture, Systems or Software or Application Development; Cloud Architecture transformation and operation; Operations, System Architecture, and Agile Development.
Effective communication skills (writing, speaking, and listening)
Experience leading the development of solutions for proposals
Experience in writing for white papers, RFI responses, and proposals
Experience in customer engagements
Development and/or Operational program experience
Ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance
